system.title: System Settings
system.storage.dataStorage.title: Default Data Storage
system.storage.dataStorage.description: Select the default storage location for storing request and response data
system.storage.dataStorage.label: Data Storage
system.storage.policy.title: Storage Policy
system.storage.policy.description: Configure storage policies and data cleanup settings to manage data retention and storage efficiency
system.storage.policy.storeChunks.label: Store Response Chunks
system.storage.policy.storeChunks.descri: When enabled, the system will store response data chunks in the database for subsequent analysis and processing. This enables detailed request tracing and debugging but increases storage usage.
system.storage.policy.storeRequestBody.d: If disabled, original request body will not be persisted. Enable this for complete request auditing and debugging. Disabling reduces storage usage and improves privacy.
If disabled, final response body will not be persisted. Enable this for complete response analysis and debugging. Disabling significantly reduces storage requirements.
system.storage.policy.cleanupDescription: Automatically remove old data after specified days to manage storage growth and comply with data retention policies. (0 = keep forever)
system.general.title: General Settings
system.general.currencyCode.label: Currency Code
system.general.currencyCode.description: For system fee display only, not used for actual billing, changes take effect in real-time
system.general.timezone.label: Timezone
system.brand.title: Brand Settings
system.brand.description: Configure basic system information and branding settings
system.brand.brandName.label: Brand Name
system.brand.brandName.description: Set the system brand name that will be displayed in the interface
system.brand.brandLogo.label: Brand Logo
system.brand.brandLogo.description: Upload a square PNG or JPEG logo (max 2MB). The logo will be displayed in the system interface.
system.brand.brandLogo.invalidFormat: Please upload a PNG or JPEG image file.
system.brand.brandLogo.fileTooLarge: File size must be less than 2MB.
system.brand.brandLogo.notSquare: Please upload a square image (width equals height).
system.retry.title: Retry Policy
system.retry.description: Configure automatic retry behavior for failed requests to improve system reliability
system.retry.enabled.label: Enable Retry
system.retry.enabled.description: When enabled, the system will automatically retry failed requests. This helps improve reliability when experiencing temporary network issues or service unavailability.
system.retry.loadBalancerStrategy.label: Load Balancer Strategy
system.retry.loadBalancerStrategy.descri: Choose how channels are ordered when routing requests.
system.retry.loadBalancerStrategy.docume: Intelligently balances multiple factors including weight, success rate, and historical performance to select the optimal channel.
Orders channels by weight. Automatically switches to the next available channel upon failure.
Model Circuit Breaker. Tracks health per channel-model combination to isolate failures. Falls back to weight when a channel is healthy.
system.retry.maxChannelRetries.label: Max Channel Retries
system.retry.maxChannelRetries.descripti: Maximum number of times to retry across different channels (0-10). When a channel fails, the system will try other available channels up to this limit. Higher values increase reliability but may increase latency.
system.retry.maxSingleChannelRetries.des: Maximum number of times to retry on the same channel (0-5). Controls how many times to retry the same channel before switching to a different channel. Useful for temporary glitches.
system.retry.retryDelayMs.label: Retry Delay (ms)
system.retry.retryDelayMs.description: Delay between retry attempts in milliseconds (100-10000ms). Shorter delays provide faster recovery but may overwhelm struggling services. Longer delays give services more time to recover.
system.retry.autoDisableChannel.label: Auto Disable Channel
system.retry.autoDisableChannel.descript: Automatically disable a channel when it exceeds the maximum number of retries for specific HTTP status codes
system.retry.autoDisableChannel.statuses: No status codes configured. Add a status code to auto-disable channels.
system.onboarding.title: System Onboarding
system.onboarding.description: Welcome to AxonHub! Let's set up your system with a quick tour.
system.onboarding.steps.welcome.title: Welcome to AxonHub!
system.onboarding.steps.welcome.descript: Let's configure your system settings to get started. This tour will guide you through setting up your brand, retry policies, and data storage.
system.onboarding.steps.brandName.title: Set Your Brand Name
system.onboarding.steps.brandName.descri: Enter your organization or project name. This will be displayed throughout the interface.
system.onboarding.steps.brandLogo.title: Add Your Logo
system.onboarding.steps.brandLogo.descri: Upload your logo to customize the look and feel of AxonHub for your organization.
system.onboarding.steps.retryPolicy.desc: Set up automatic retry behavior for failed requests to improve reliability.
system.onboarding.steps.retryEnabled.des: Toggle retry functionality on or off. When enabled, failed requests will be automatically retried.
Set the maximum number of retry attempts for failed requests. Higher values increase reliability but may delay failure notifications.
system.onboarding.steps.retrySingleChann: Configure how many times to retry on the same channel before switching. Useful for temporary glitches.
system.onboarding.steps.retryDelay.title: Retry Delay
system.onboarding.steps.retryDelay.descr: Set the delay between retry attempts. Shorter delays provide faster recovery but may overwhelm struggling services.
system.onboarding.steps.dataStorage.desc: Configure how your data is stored and managed. This is important for performance and compliance.
system.onboarding.steps.storageEnabled.d: Choose what types of data to store. You can enable storage for chunks, request bodies, and response bodies.
system.onboarding.steps.storageChunks.de: Enable chunk storage for streaming responses. This allows you to view partial responses and analyze streaming behavior.
system.onboarding.steps.storageRequestBo: Save request payloads for debugging and analysis. This increases storage usage but provides valuable insights.
system.onboarding.steps.storageResponseB: Save response payloads for auditing and analysis. This significantly increases storage usage but provides complete data.
system.onboarding.steps.dataStorageSelec: Choose the storage backend for the request and response data. Different backends offer different performance and cost characteristics. Default is database, you can also configure other storage backends.
system.onboarding.steps.storageCleanupRe: Configure automatic cleanup for request data to manage storage space and maintain system performance.
system.onboarding.steps.storageCleanupUs: Set up cleanup policies for usage logs to comply with data retention requirements and optimize storage.
system.onboarding.steps.complete.title: Setup Complete!
system.onboarding.steps.complete.descrip: Great! Your system is now configured. You can always modify these settings later in the System Settings page.
system.about.title: About AxonHub
system.about.description: System version information and update status
system.about.updateCheck.title: Check for Updates
system.about.updateCheck.description: Check if a newer version is available
system.about.updateCheck.upToDate: You are running the latest version
system.about.links.title: Links
system.backup.title: Backup
system.backup.description: Create a backup of your system data including channels, model prices, models, and API keys
system.restore.title: Restore
system.restore.description: Restore your system data from a backup file
system.restore.warning: Warning: Restoring from a backup will overwrite existing data. This action cannot be undone.
system.autoBackup.title: Auto Backup
system.autoBackup.description: Configure automatic backups to WebDAV storage
system.autoBackup.enabled.label: Enable Auto Backup
system.autoBackup.enabled.description: When enabled, the system will automatically create backups at the specified frequency
system.autoBackup.frequency.label: Backup Frequency
system.autoBackup.webdav.title: WebDAV Configuration
system.autoBackup.webdav.pathDescription: Path on WebDAV server where backups will be stored
system.autoBackup.webdav.insecureSkipTLS: Skip TLS certificate verification (not recommended for production)
system.autoBackup.options.title: Backup Options
system.autoBackup.retentionDaysDescripti: Number of days to keep backups (0 = keep forever)
system.autoBackup.lastBackup.title: Last Backup Status
system.autoBackup.triggerNowTooltip: Please save WebDAV URL, username, and password first
system.providerQuota.title: Provider Quotas
